title: Centro de Ensino Unificado de Brasília Esporte Clube
text:
Centro de Ensino Unificado de Brasília Esporte Clube, commonly known as CEUB, were a <a href="Brazil">Brazil</a>ian <a href="association%20football">football</a> club from <a href="Bras%C3%ADlia">Brasília</a>. They won the <a href="Campeonato%20Brasiliense">Campeonato Brasiliense</a> once and competed in the <a href="Campeonato%20Brasileiro%20S%C3%A9rie%20A">Série A</a> three times.
History.
They were founded in 1968, by college students of Centro de Ensino Unificado de Brasília (UniCEUB). The club won the <a href="Campeonato%20Brasiliense">Campeonato Brasiliense</a> in 1973, when they beat <a href="Associa%C3%A7%C3%A3o%20Atl%C3%A9tica%20Rela%C3%A7%C3%B5es%20Exteriores%20de%20Bras%C3%ADlia">Relações Exteriores</a> in the final. They competed in the <a href="Campeonato%20Brasileiro%20S%C3%A9rie%20A">Série A</a> in <a href="Campeonato%20Brasileiro%20S%C3%A9rie%20A%201973">1973</a>, <a href="Campeonato%20Brasileiro%20S%C3%A9rie%20A%201974">1974</a> and in <a href="Campeonato%20Brasileiro%20S%C3%A9rie%20A%201975">1975</a>. CEUB closed their professional football department in 1976 under Adílson Peres' term as the club's president.
Stadium.
The club played their home games at the <a href="Pelez%C3%A3o">Pelezão</a> stadium. The stadium had a maximum capacity of 20,000 people.
